intro: Clompanus rubiginosa, commonly known as the rusty clompanus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are often covered in a reddish or rusty-colored pubescence. Its flowers are typically small, with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
